Military Secret.
From Viceroy, Army Department, 12th June 1917. (Received at India Office, 12.30 p.m.)
8603. Your telegram of the 7th instant, 3467. All possible steps are being taken to safeguard the health of troops in Waziristan Field Force, and to make complete the arrangements for accommodation, evacuation and treatment of casualties from this force. Our resources in medical personnel are however limited and are being strained to the utmost to meet the requirements of Waziristan Field Force, and at the same time to satisfy essential needs elsewhere. Our position in regard to medical personnel in the case of operations on the Frontier has already beeu fully explained in the correspondence commencing with my telegram of the 15th October lasj;, 11552, and ending with my telegram of the 30th ultimo, 7942, and we trust immediate re-inforcements asked for in the last quoted communication will be sent out at once.
